intro: Ricinocarpus setosus, commonly known as the hairy sea bean, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in coastal areas and saline environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and palmate leaves with a serrated margin. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Ricinocarpus setosus is adapted to withstand high salinity and is often found in intertidal zones along tropical and subtropical coasts.
